page.title: 11Yetholm Health & Romany H.
page.content: The present day surgery opened in July 1972 at Cheviot Place, replacing upon retirement the surgery held in Dr. Turnbull's house in Kirk Yetholm.Now part of the Health Centre Clinic in Kelso with six doctors, the village still retains its own doctor and district nurse. Both visit the village daily for surgery appointments and home visits. Patients requiring operations attend Peel or Edinburgh while babies are born in Kelso Cottage Hospital or Edinburgh. {ROMANY HOUSE} A former hotel, Romany House built in the 1880's has for the last twenty six years been an Old Peoples Home for a maximum of 21 fee paying residents. The building is maintained by the Borders Region. Nine full time and eight part time local people, nurse, cook and take care of the residents.
